Key Match Events: India won by 7 wickets with 51 balls remaining.
India chased down the target of 257 in 41.3 overs.
Jasprit Bumrah led India's bowling attack, taking 28 out of a possible 30 wickets in the tournament so far.
Rohit Sharma's ultra-aggressive approach has been the highlight of India's batting performances.
Pre-Game Insights: India were looking to secure their fourth win in the tournament.
Bangladesh had a 3-1 ODI record against India in the last 12 months.
Bangladesh's only win against India in the ODI World Cup was in 2007.
Shakib Al Hasan's availability was uncertain due to a quadriceps injury.
India's bowling coach Paras Mhambrey emphasized not taking any team lightly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was Bangladesh's first ODI against India in India in 25 years.
Virat Kohli has an average of 67.25 and a strike rate of 101.25 in 15 ODIs against Bangladesh.
Shakib, Taskin, and Mustafizur all have five-wicket hauls against India in ODIs.
The match was played in Pune, where teams batting first have posted 300-plus totals in three out of five ODIs since 2017.
